attributes.action: force petrol stations to prominently display their price per gallon, to provide clarity in their highly suspicious price increases.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This petition is NOT about petrol tax, but the amount of 1p per litre price increases we have all seen recently. Since petrol reached the £1 a litre mark, the price has risen by 1p almost DAILY. But if prices were displayed in gallons, would retailers DARE to raise their prices by 4 1/2p each time? Of course not. But by raising a litre by 1p, that is exactly what they are doing. And apart from this, I demand the RIGHT to buy any commodity by whatever measurement I choose!

rejection.details:
It is not possible to understand what you mean by "highly suspicious price increases".
Also, your concerns would be better addressed to retailers rather than government.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
